title: Welcome To My Blog

This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Greg Johnson's Blog
text:
---
title: "THE BIG TEN SUCKS AT MARCH MADNESS"
author: "GREG JOHNSON"
date: '2022-04-16'
categories: [sos, ppg, sweetsixteen]
image: "image.png"
format: 
  html:
    code-fold: true
---

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.0     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.1     ✔ tibble    3.1.8
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors



stats <- read_csv("http://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/stats23.csv")

Rows: 363 Columns: 34
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): School, Season
dbl (32): Rank, Games, OverallWins, OverallLosses, WinPct, OverallSRS, Overa...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

teams <- c("Nebraska", "Iowa", "Northwestern", "Minnesota", "Wisconsin", "Illinois", "Indiana", "Purdue", "Michigan", "Michigan State", "Ohio State", "Penn State", "Rutgers", "Maryland")

tournament <- c("Iowa", "Northwestern", "Maryland", "Indiana", "Penn State", "Illinois", "Michigan State", "Purdue")

big <- stats %>% filter(School %in% teams)

dance <- stats %>% filter(School %in% tournament)

mi <- stats %>% filter(School == "Michigan State")

Text Example One

ggplot() +
  geom_point(data=stats, aes(x=ForPoints/Games, y=OppPoints/Games), color="grey") +
  geom_point(data=big, aes(x=ForPoints/Games, y=OppPoints/Games), color="blue") +
  geom_point(data=mi, aes(x=ForPoints/Games, y=OppPoints/Games), color="#18453B") +
  labs(
    title="Offensive and Defensive Points Per Game",
    subtitle="Big Ten likes to play defense",
    x="Points Per Game", 
    y="Opponent Points Per Game",
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Greg Johnson")+
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold")
    )
